sense.name: action or sequence
sense.commentary: PROCEDURE[+event] An action, or a series of actions, intended to produce a specific result. This is probably the most common sense.
sense.examples: The strike halted all government procedures for a month. What's the most effective procedure for writing a term paper? I brought legal procedures against John after he insulted me. He underwent a small surgical procedure on his tonsils. He began the procedure of obtaining a driver's license. He didn't know the proper procedure for building a house.

sense.name: set of instructions
sense.commentary: Refers to the set of instructions for an action or series of actions. Clearly not the action itself.
sense.examples: Good cops always operate according to procedure. I wrote the official company procedure for dealing with customer complaints. I highly recommend that you follow standard operating procedures when using the spinning saw blade.

sense.name: tiresome action
sense.commentary: PROCEDURE[+event] A specific kind of action (or series of actions), which is understood to be exhausting and unpleasant.
sense.examples: John soon found that building the shelf by hand was quite a procedure.

sense.name: computer program
sense.commentary: The small set of steps that forms part of a larger computer program.
sense.examples: I wrote a small procedure that ends the program after twenty minutes.
